reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for a wedding 'evening do' and we were very happy with the hotel. Stayed in a classic room which was the cheapest room but it was well appointed, nicely decorated and of good quality fixtures and fittings.
reviews.title: Beautiful setting and lovely rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ordered room service; the food was excellent and promptly served.
reviews.title: Very relaxing, great location, perfect to unwind

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Didn't use the spa or restaurant so can't comment on that.
reviews.title: A great location - but get a room with a view and check out the menus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was included in the price (£145) and this was excellent with a choice of cereals, continental and cooked full english.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in great location with fantastic fine dining and excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would definitely like to go back and try the spa out as the whole area is perfect for just chilling out.
reviews.title: Lovely location and property, but restaurant VERY overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just come back from a wonderful one night stay in this beautifull hotel.
reviews.title: More Like 5***** Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff all made you feel special. Didnt use the spa but it looked realy nice.
reviews.title: wot a let down !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was fantastic and both dinner and breakfast perfect.
reviews.title: Well worth another visit, just for the breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only downside was the Bar area,which could do with a make over and some soft music.
reviews.title: Peace in the Middle of Nowhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A bit like a bad witherspoons. Otherwise Exellent !!
reviews.title: Beautiful Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011
reviews.text: A lovely location for my niece's wedding. Staff very good and helpful. The main 'niggles' in our room related to the poor lighting. Perhaps meant to be 'mood' lighting but was not sufficient when dressing for the wedding/evening. The only full length mirror did not have a light nearby; the socket I had to use for the hairdryer was not in a comfortable position as I had to use a small mirror. One of the wardrobe lights did not work and no replacement bulb was available in the hotel. The light in the cupboard where the drinks tray was stored did not work but did get replaced, although the working light was not sufficient for the cupboard area. There was no extractor fitted in the bathroom. The 'plugged' sink drained faster than it could be filled.
reviews.title: Good location for the wedding but 'niggles' in room and food disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel heating was much higher than needed to be - could save money here?
reviews.title: A simply stunning and relaxing location, with superb service throughout

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was disappointing. Breakfast was fine - usual full English, continental etc.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The meal on the first evening was part of a two day deal. The deal menu was not inspiring so we chose 'A La Carte' with a reduction relating to the deal. I am more than happy with 'minimal' meals but the experimenting of flavours spoiled the dishes. E.g. the Duck Terrine chosen by 2 of our party was served with what turned out to be a long roll of dark chocolate. One taste of the chocolate ruined the whole course as the flavour was totally overwhelming. I had lobster salad for my main course, and apart from one small piece, the lobster was tough and difficult to even cut. Six of us did not bother to try the sweet course.
reviews.title: 4 star?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At the wedding breakfast, the parsnip soup with apple puree was the most tasteless starter I have ever tried and some likened it to dishwater. Most smiled and ate it; I managed half and gave up. The main course was fine but the sweet was very sickly (Chocolate tarte) and many people did not eat or left some. Appreciate that the bride and groom chose the food but not sure if they sampled it first.
reviews.title: Don't get your hopes up - the location is completely let down by the manager and his attitude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at Wood Hall over Mother's Day weekend. My husband and I took his parents for Mother's Day.
reviews.title: Exceeded expectations by far

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked Wood Hall because it seemed to tick all the boxes but was concerend by some of the reviews (posted pre our stay in March 2011) about service issues etc especially when they have weddings on.
reviews.title: Overall pretty close to excellent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival my heart dropped there was a wedding on and the wedding guests were staying for the whole weekend as we were. However I have to say the hotel staff managed the logistics of keeping hotel guests and wedding party guests separated and serviced extremely well.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel and wedding venue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived and had a fabulous afternoon tea in the lounge, the service never faultered. Service at dinner and the food were excellent and at breakfast the wedding guests were seated in the function room while hotel guests were in the Georgian dining room. If we hadn't known you would never have realised there was a large wedding party staying in the hotel.
reviews.title: Lovely place to stay but check the review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked two executive rooms which had beautiful views and large oval bay windows.
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic
